text: Bessie Regina Norris (December 21, 1953 â€“ May 10, 2020), better known by her stage name Betty Wright, was an American soul and R&B; singer-songwriter and background vocalist. She became famous in the 1970s with hits such as "Clean Up Woman" and "Tonight Is the Night". Wright was born in Miami, Florida. Wright died of endometrial cancer on May 10, 2020 in Miami. She was 66. ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2020 deaths Category:African- American singers Category:American soul singers Category:American R&B; singers Category:American gospel singers Category:American funk singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Deaths from endometrial cancer Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:Singers from Miami Category:Writers from Miami
title: Betty Wright
